alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 8:56AM CDT until April 27 at 12:09PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Twin Valley affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. .Minnesota tributaries are seeing rises in river level due to current rainfall and snow melt. Minor flood stage will be reached at most points within the next 24 hours, with moderate flood stage possible later in the week along the Wild Rice River. Crest should be reached by midweek, although will be subject to ongoing rainfall. This product includes observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sand Hill River at Climax. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 22.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
